comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: According to Wikipedia, "Count Francis Conrad von Hötzendorf (November 11, 1852 – August 25, 1925) was an Austrian soldier and Chief of the General Staff of the Austro-Hungarian Army at the outbreak of World War I."

comment.author: 52001525@N05
comment._content: why did they changed his name into Francis when it was "Franz Graf Conrad von Hötzendorf"? I understand if one translates "Graf" into "count" for a better understanding, but I don't understand why they also translated his name into English ...
